g.text: I define ghosts as human’s contradictory exploration of the unknown, which is stim-lated by our curiosity and limited by our fears.This exploration and the development of technology promote each other. The increase of technology makes it easier to explore and visualize the unknown. On the one hand, because machine vision restores the original appearances of things (such as adapting the dark environment by cameras and correcting the distorted images), we can obvi-ously eliminate parts of fears of the unknown in terms of vision and perception. On the other hand, technology extends human’s vision. As a result, invisible objects that arouse our curiosity are greatly reduced. Therefore technology is to some extent elimi-nating the existing ghosts.During this course, however, are there any unprecedented ghosts transferred to tech-nology? What kind of unknowns can technology produce?

我将幽灵定义为人类对未知的矛盾性探索。这种探索被我们的好奇心所激发并被我们的恐惧所限制，并且跟技术的发展相互促进。技术使得我们更加容易去探索和可视化未知的存在。更具体地说，一方面因为更加先进的机器视觉对事物原貌的还原（比如说对相机昏暗环境的补光，对被人眼所扭曲的图像的矫正），我们可以在观感和认知上明显消除对未知的部分恐惧；另一方面，因为技术扩展了人眼可视的范围，能引起我们好奇的不可见物也大大减少。所以技术在一定程度上在消减已有的幽灵。但是，在这一过程中，是否有新的幽灵转移到了技术上？技术能产生什么样的与以往不同的未知呢？
